result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark B Baral was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 5/26/15 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail to apply if applicable.
Consecutive to: Conscutive to any sentence.  Straight time.  Court recommends against electronic monitoring.

Defendant shall provide a DNA samle for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark B Baral

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.
Court sentenced defendant to serve 4 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 10 days served; Straight time. Court recommends against electronic monitoring. 

Court orders defendant to pay all cost, fees and surcharges by 5/26/2015 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

*COURT DOES NOT SUSPEND DRIVING PRIVILEGES.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey Murrell.  Defendant Mark B Baral in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court vacates the warrant.    The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 11/25/2014, in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Jeffrey Murrell in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has picked up new charges in Greenfield.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.
Fokus Family Service progress report, received and filed. lms

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the report.  Defendant has tested negative and is consistently attending treatment.  Defendant needs to begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for November 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant has tested negative.  Defendant to begin community service.  Defendant has consistently attended and actively engaged in treatment.  Review hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is consistent with attendant and actively participating.  Defendant's last test with positive, but informs court future test will be negative.  Defendant is employed and will begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for July 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Based on defendant's appearance court canceled the bench warrant.   DPA agreement to continue.  Defendant to provide documentation.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6. Review hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey L Murrell in court.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense counsel has had no contact with Attorney Murrell.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  No bond forfeited at this time.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Brad A Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defense is requesting an adjournment to work closely with client in getting connected with treatment.    Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey Lee Murrell.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 44.
  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  Review hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Case transferred forthwith to Judge Wagner, Br. 38 for change of plea./ds

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case may be resolved with a possible DPA. Defendant needs a TAD evaluation. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for March 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey L Murrell.  Dennis Murphy for Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mark B Baral in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark B Baral not in court.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case set for initial appearance. Per Assistant District Attorney Steve Glamm request for a stayed warrant, granted by the Court.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1-15-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
